results.title: Wyrd sisters: from Terry Pratchett's discworld. Parte one
results.brief_description: Great A’Tuin is a giant turtle, floating through space, and on his back stand four elephants, on their backs, there rests the Discworld. This is the setting for Terry Pratchett’s adventure, the ‘Discworld’. This tape contains episodes one to three. In these epsiodes witch Granny Weatherwax finds a baby like no other. There is also stately matters afoot, and with the assistance of her companions Magrat and Nanny Ogg, they go to extreme lengths to deliver the recognition that the King, who has been ousted by the wretched Duke, deserves.

results.title: Wynken, Blynken and Nod
results.brief_description: Barbara Cooney has lent her delicate talent to the gentle and dreamlike illustrations that illuminate the haunting beauty of this poem, now a part of the permanent treasury of poems for children.

results.title: Wyatt Earp
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Kasdan, Kevin Costner, Jim Wilson, Kasdan Pictures and TIG Productions
results.brief_description: Wyatt Earp was one of the most famous lawmen of the american Wild West. With his friend Doc Holliday, Earp and his brothers tried to keep law and order in a land where lawlessness and violence was a way of life. Kevin Costner stars as Wyatt Earp in this epic production and is ably supported by Gene Hackman who plays Earp’s strong-willed father, and Dennis Quaid who is excellent as the sickly but lethal Doc Holliday.

results.title: Wuthering heights [Cavanah]
results.creator_credit: David Skynner, Louise Berridge, WGBH (Boston) and LWT
results.brief_description: Based on Emily Bronte’s 1847 novel, this production professes to differ from other adaptations by covering the complete story and adhering closely to the spirit of the original text. This includes an emphasis on supernatural forces which contribute to the demise of the characters. Cast includes Robert Cavanah, Orla Brady and Peter Davison.

results.title: Wuthering Heights
results.creator_credit: Robert Fuest and Samuel Z Arkoff
results.brief_description: Based on Emily Bronte’s novel of defiant young lovers and set in the 18th Century amidst the harsh realities of the Yorkshire moors. This version is considered a good and realistic treatment of Bronte’s novel with authentic locations. Starring Timothy Dalton as Heathcliff and Anne Calder-Marshall as Cathy.

results.title: Wrong world
results.creator_credit: Ian Pringle, Bryce Menzies and Seon Film Productions
results.brief_description: After rejecting the conventional career path of a successful practice, an idealistic young doctor recalls, 8 years later, time spent in Bolivia, drug addiction and a trip across America. During a course of rehabilitation in Melbourne he meets a young woman, an addict and petty thief. The recollection of this indeterminate journey suggests the disconnected process of memory. The title suggests how the different worlds in which the doctor has travelled in search of meaning have only increased his sense of dislocation. Photographed by Ray Argall. Cast includes Richard Moir and Jo Kennedy.

results.title: Wrong way Butch
results.creator_credit: David Barclay, Peter Smith and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Peter Smith, aided by Dave O’Brien as a factory operative who never does the right thing, offers some hints on industrial safety. As in the NFB of Canada “Accidents don’t happen” series, a humorous approach is successfully used to sweeten important lessons. Both a good comedy and an excellent training film for machine-tool workers, apprentices and pupils in technical schools.

results.title: Wrong side of the road
results.creator_credit: Ned Lander, Graeme Isaac, Australian Film Commission and Inma Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into what it’s like to be young and black in Australia by introducing two rock bands “No Fixed Address” and “Us Mob” and following them through two days on the road. The film is punctuated by run-ins between the young musicians and white authority. “Wrong side of the road” shows a courageous minority standing up to a racist society, the close relationship within the black community and the respect given to women within this community.
